intro: Bikkia tubiflora, commonly known as the clustered bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Bikkia tubiflora has hairy stems and leaves that are heart-shaped with a serrated edge.
